1.content:
Lots, and I mean lots of girls to choose from, and you can pick them all. Just follow the categories to find the character you want to see grow.

The Protagonists- The Hero of Ferelden, The Champion of Kirkwall, and the Inquisitor can be chosen through here and made to gain.

Party Members- All the women that can go into your party in any game are through here.

Major NPCs- Characters such as Anora and Josphine.

Minor NPCs- Characters such as Iona and Bianca.

OCs- Self explanatory.
1.title: Starting point.

The Champion of Kirkwall- Choose the class and alignment of Hawke.

The Inqusitor- Decide which visitor of the Conclave got the Anchor.

1111.content: Which Human origin is the Hero?
1111.title: Human Warden: Origin.

choices: Iona accepts, eager to spend the night with the larger woman.
Iona declines, turned off by Elissa’s size.
11111.content:
It wasn’t fair. Why did Fergus get to with their father to Ostagar? She was a more skilled warrior than the two of them put together, yet she had to stay in the castle like always. I could kill every last darkspawn if they would just let me. Elissa thought to herself as she munched on the sweet rolls she nabbed while getting her dog from the larder. It felt like all she did these days was eat and swing her sword at training dummies, strengthening her muscles while a thick layer of fat grew over them. She started up the stairs to her brother’s room to give him a message from father, and at the same time she began eating the fifth to last sweet roll.

“Ah, here comes my daughter now, and what a supprise, she’s stuffing her face again.” Ellissa’s cheeks turned red at her mother’s remark. She quickly swallowed what was in her mouth and hid the rest behind her back, hoping her mother and the three with her didn’t notice. Ever since she had started gaining weight, her mother would chide Elissa for every extra pound she put on, regardless of whether it was mucsle or fat.

“Oh, Elissa, you will never get a husband if your belly is so big!” She had the gall to say to her once. As if she even wanted a husband. What was so great about them? What was so special about this stupid idiot here with his dumb face? Okay, that’s not fair, he’s probably not stupid. And his face probably isn’t dumb. It could be. I don’t know. Elissa couldn’t help feeling a little testy that day, and her father refusing to acknowledge her as a warrior and not just a daughter was just tossing wood onto the fire.

Her mother introduced Elissa to the people she was no doubt bad mouthing her to a few moments ago. There was Lady something-or-other who was her mother’s age that Elissa vaguely remembered, the Lady’s son with the maybe stupid face, who Elissa’s mother no doubt wanted to set her up with by the way she talked about him, and the woman’s lady-in-waiting, Iona. The other two were probably nice people, but Elissa was not in much of a mood for people today, especially after having to deal with Nan and Barkspawn. Pretty girls like Iona, however, were a different matter entirely. She was always in the mood for pretty girls.

Iona and Elissa talked again later in the castle study, but not before she sat through another tounge lashing from her mother. When they did get together they spoke of Iona’s daughter, and her position as a lady-in-waiting. She didn’t notice it before because her hair covered her ears, but when Elissa learned Iona was an Elf they had a polite and civilized conversation about Elves and how they were treated in Human society. There was also some definite flirting between the two, and when she felt she might get a yes out of her (or at least not too harsh of a no) Elissa asked Iona up to her room.
11111.title: Human Noble: Elissa Cousland.

choices: Howe’s men. The origin continues as normal. Mostly.
Elissa’s mother. Howe never attacks, and the Elissa keeps living the easy life.
111111.content:
Eager for her night with Iona, Elissa wanted to give her brother their father’s message quickly then retire to her room. Instead they had a little family gathering in her brother’s room. The subject of Elissa taking Iona to bed came up, as much as she tried to avoid it. Her mother and sister-in-law didn’t approve, but Fergus congratulated her. Elissa could sometimes get jealous of her older brother, but he was so nice she couldn’t be mad at him. By the time everyone went off to bed for the night, Elissa almost felt too tired for her night with Iona. That changed when she saw Iona sprawled out on her bed in nothing but her small clothes.

Piece by piece the slender Elf helped the plump noblewoman out of her armor, until she, too, was only in her bra and underwear, and those came off soon after. Elissa stood naked in front of Iona with an obvious blush on her face; this was her first night with a woman since she started putting on weight, and she was more than a little nervous. The way Iona looked her up and down gave her butterflies in her stomach. Was she having second thoughts?

All her fears were washed away, however, when Iona placed her hand on Iona’s tubby gut and said, “You’re even more beautiful than I thought.” She then led Elissa to bed. They intertwined for a night of passion, with Iona taking a more assertive role than Elissa would have expected. The relatively small woman seemed especially interested in the areas Elissa’s body that had become soft from her over eating instead of the parts of her hardened by her training. Having the beginnings of her second chin kissed, or her soft abdomen caressed was more pleasurable than Elissa could have imagined. By the end of their love making, Iona had shed new light on what Elissa thought of her added pudge, allowing her to think of it in a not so negative matter.

A second round was out of the question, much as they both desired it, as Barkspawn decided to join them in bed. Elissa forced him to sleep at the foot of the bed, so at least they could cuddle together while they slept. However their time together was further interupted by the mabari when he began barking at the door in the middle of the night. Iona reluctantly got up to check what was causing the hound to act in such a way. When she opened the door, Iona was met by…
111111.title: Iona accepts, eager to spend the night with the...

choices: Elissa offers to cook. Morrigan approves, and gains.
Morrigan disapproves but does the cooking, and Elissa gains more.
1111111.content:
Everything else felt like it happened so fast. Iona hit the floor. So did Howe’s men. The castle fell and everyone Elissa knew was dying, and she left her parents to die as a Grey Warden recruit, with only Fergus and Barkspawn being her only living family. The travel to Ostagar was long and quiet with few words spoken between Elissa and Duncan, the Grey Warden that had ‘saved’ her. She got to meet the King of Fereleden, and he swore to her that Howe would pay, and that she would be reunited with Fergus after the battle. It did little to help, but it was something. Duncan told her to get some rest, and maybe something to eat before her initiation before her left, which she did. Elise helped herself to plenty of food from around camp, and met the two other recruits, as well as a Junior Warden. All three nice, but Elissa was still in shock, and couldn’t talk to them much.

She stayed in shock through the four’s quest in the Korcari Wilds, after meeting two Witches of the Wilds, all the way up to when she went through the Joining, and then Elissa finally came back. She got the thrill of a battle she wanted! She killed Genlocks, Hemlocks, and an Emissary as she charged up the Tower of Ishal with the Junior Warden, Alistair and Barkspawn to light the beacon at the top! It would signal the armies, and she would have been an instrumental part in stoping a blight before it began! She felt unstoppable when she killed an Ogre with her great sword and lit the signal fire! Then Teyrn Loghain Mac Tir told his armies to retreat, and everyone started dying again. All becaus of another betrayal.

The next thing she knew she was in a bed with a beautiful woman standing over her; one of the Witches she met in the Wilds. “Good, you’re awake.” She said as Elissa sat up at the edge of the bed. She noticed she didn’t have any clothes on, but it didn’t seem to bother the other woman. “You should find all your wounds healed. There were many.”

“I…” Elissa tried to talk but her mouth was to dry. The witch gave her a cup full of what Elissa assed was tea and began to drink it. It tasted wonderful and felt good flowing down her throat and into her belly. It was warm and filling; like thick soup broth.

With Elissa drinking the liquid, the witch the time to explain to her what happened. Elissa took the news better than if she had heard it before what happened to her family, but now…well, she wasn’t used to it, but it didn’t make her want to curl up into a ball and cry. On the brighter side of things, both Alister and Barkspawn had also survived. Once she finally did finish the liquid, Elissa’a voice had returned. “Thank you for taking care of me, and my friend, and my dog, Morrigan.”

“‘Twas my mother who did most of the work, but you are welcome, none the less. ‘Twould seem you also have some of the fat on your belly to thank as well. It stopped an arrow that would have otherwise been the end of you.” Morrigan said, then poked her index finger into Elissa’s tubby middle, causing the noble to blush. “Now, get dressed and go outside, Mother wishes to speak with you.”

Elissa nodded, and began to put her armor back on, noting that it was a big more snug than when she previously wore it. Morrigan turned to attend a stove, and Elissa stepped outside the hutt, and was reunited with Barkspawn and Alistair, and met again with Flemeth. The three put together a plan (Barkspawn had little to offer on the subject) to gather an army, to stop both the Blight and Loghain. When Morrigan came out to ask Flemeth if they would be having guests for dinner, Flemeth offered to have Morrigan go with Elissa. At first Morrigan was reluctant, but eventually resigned to having to go with them.

“Hey, at least now we have someone other than me to cook now. Unless you like all your meals to taste like grey.” Alistair jested as the four began their journey towards a town Morrigan suggested.

Morrigan ‘tsked’ and rolled her eyes. “I do know some recipes, if that is really how you want me to use my time.”
1111111.title: Howe’s men. The origin continues as normal. M...

choices: Before moving on, Elissa wants to have a word with Morrigan.
11111111.content:
She wouldn’t say it, but Morrigan greatly preferred Elissa’s cooking to her own. Even something simple like rabbit stew tasted better than anything she or her mother had ever made when prepared by the noble. Another thing she wouldn’t admit to was that she had been helping herself to a few too many extra servings. The two Wardens would look to the dog when there was no food left in the morning, after all one lithe woman couldn’t eat the whole batch. Though, lithe was not a word she could use to describe herself if she kept eating like she had been. While nowhere near as large as their leader, Morrigan was beginning to get a bit of a belly, but her choice of clothing kept it hidden for the time being.

Lothering—the town Morrigan had told the party about—soon came into view as they walked down the Imperial Highway, with so shifty looking characters between them and the city. They presented themselves as toll collectors, but Elissa didn’t buy it, and they switched from trying to swindle them to robbing Elissa and her party. Once the thugs were sufficiently beaten, Elissa asked their leader a few questions before forcing the bandits to turn over all they had stolen and leave. Apparently Loghain had been busy since Ostagar; declaring himself regent and blaming the Grey Wardens for the loss at Ostagar.

“Well, there it is, Lothering. Pretty as painting.” Alistair commented as they walked down a ramp off the Imperial Highway.

“Ah, so, you’ve finally decided to rejoin you us, have you? Falling on your blade in grief seemed like too much trouble, I take it.” Morrigan said back, prompting Elissa to sigh. She’d only known the two a short time and already Elissa could tell they would not be getting along better than absolutely necessary.

Alistair turned and glared at the witch. “Is my being upset so hard for you to understand? Have you never lost someone important to you?” He said spitefully. “What would you do if your mother died?”

“Before or after I stopped laughing?”

“Riiiight, very creepy, forget I asked.”

Elissa cleared her throat to get the attention of her companions. If she didn’t they probably would have kept going until the Darkspawn arrived. “If you two are done, I think it’s about time we talk about where we’ll go first…”

Alistair nodded and scratched his chin. “Right. I think Flemeth suggested the best plan. Have you checked the old treaties?”

“I did. And I think I’ve got a good idea how to go about using them.” Elissa said as she pulled out her map and showed it to her companions. “We have a treaty with the Circle of Magi, and of the three they’re the closest. We pick up so mage and maybe Templar support then head south to Redcliff to get Eamon’s support.” Elissa explained, hoping that Alistair and Morrigan wouldn’t disagree simply because it would mean they agreed on something. This quest would be one involving lots of travel, and as more time passed, Elissa found herself less and less fit for long journeys. Especially now that her thighs rubbed together as she walked.

“Hmm, it’s better than anything I could come up with.” Alistair said simply after thinking it over.

Morrigan stared at him with disgust. “Don’t insult the poor woman; the dog could make a better plan than you. Hers required actual thought and planing.”

Sighing to herself, Elissa shook her head. To think she actually wanted to go on an adventure like this back before this had all started.
11111111.title: The Long Road Ahead.

Hawke’s nature is nothing like the story implied, as she is brash and aggressive
1132.content:
The time that passed after her confrontation with Varric allowed Cassandra think about the situation with a more leveled head. While Hawke could have became inquisitor, she could have just as easily died at the Conclave, like the Trevelyan pointed out. There was no point to wondering what may have happened; things were the way they were and there was no changing them. Besides, Inquisitor Trevelyan was a more than competent leader, while Hawke’s skills were…debatable. The Dwarf was prone to extravagant lies.

When she thought about it, Cassandra realized she hand’t even seen Hawke yet. She was too busy yelling at the one how hid Hawke from her. She didn’t know if the woman lived up Varric’s…more likely romanticized tales. Varric had accused her of it when he told her the story of Hawke battling the Arishok to save at-the-time lover Isabela, but she would never admit that she had developed a case of hero worship. The tales of her deeds were just impressive, and her romantic nature left her wanting to helieve them.

Cassandra found her feet leading her towards Herald’s Rest where Hawke resided to finally sate her curiousity about the woman. Sitting at the tavern’s bar was Hawke in her Champion Armor, her two daggers on her back…
1132.title: Hero Worship.

choices: Cassandra slaps her hand away. She’s furious with her!
Cassandra shakes Hawke’s hand. She’s star struck!
11322.content:
Varric’s descriptive powers as a writer were not to be taken lightly. Sure, while Cassandra interrogated him, a few caves and buildings he described were fairly similar, but he had painted a perfect picture of Hawke with words. She looked exactly like Cassandra had imagined she would, from the armor, to the blood swipe, to the color of her crystal blue eyes; even Hawke’s smile had every ounce of charm she expected it would. With the addition of a grey hair or two, though they were more likely the result of recent stress than Varric’s inaccuracy in the telling of his story.

After taking a swig from her mug of ale, the raven haired woman finished the story she was telling Bull and Sera, “…so I’m hanging onto his horns for dear life, and I just know if I let go I’ll get impaled. Then, out of nowhere, and just when I thought he was about to shake me off, Tuckson charges at full speed and—ahem ‘neutered’ the Arishok. Needless to say the fight was over after that.”

“Balls! Now that’s how you finish a fight! We need a friggin’ dog!” Sera said with a laugh.

“Haha! No wonder the circumstances of his death were so covered up!” Bull added.

“Varric may add a bit of embellishment, but there’s always some truth to his stories. Except the one about me rolling into battle with food on my face. I trip one time while trying to get something out of my teeth and I never hear the end of it!” The two members of the Inquisitor’s Inner Circle burst into laughter, and even Hawke couldn’t help herself from joining in.

“It sounds as though you two are having a fun time.” Cassandra said with her arms crossed as she approached the three.

“Hey, Cassandra, have you met Marian? She’s friggin’ daft!” Sera said, her smile wide as she waved the Seeker over.

“Uh, say, Sera, let’s go… eh, hit something. Krem! Get your shield!” Bull called out to his Lieutenant, sensing the impending tense confrontation between Cassandra and Hawke. He had to practically drag Sera away from the Ferelden-turned-Freemarcher hero.

With the other two gone, Hawke stood from her barstool and offered an open hand to Cassandra to shake. “Marian Hawke. Though most just call me Hawke. Even my sister. Marian makes me sound like an old woman.”

choices: Cassandra. The Seeker of Truth could easily train her for combat and leadership.
Vivienne. Another Circle mage should be able to help her aclimatiz.
11431.content:
Being of noble birth, Evelyn’s life in the Circle was far more luxurious than that of the average mage. Just about everything was handed up to her on a silver platter; literally in most cases. With so little to do other than study magic, Evelyn would fill most of her free time with either food or sex, which left her more out of shape and heavier than the other mages in the tower. Yet, however spoiled she may have been, she was not stupid. She knew other mages in other Circle towers were suffering, but she was just as confined to her tower as they were to theirs, and could do nothing to help them. So, she enjoyed her pleasurable, if boring, existence for all her years in the towe. That is until the Devine called for the conclave, and she was given the opportunity to not only venture out of the tower as she dreamt of, but to help her fellow mages as well.

That plan, of course, went up in flames along with the rest of Haven, and set her on the path to become the leader of the Inquisition. However, an overweight, out of shape, poorly adjusted did not make for a good leader. She would need help if she ever wanted to make a difference, and she had just the person in mind to whip her into shape, for the sake of not just her fellow mages, but all of Thedas, and she had just the person in mind. This person was, of course, none other than…
11431.title: Human: Evelyn Travelyan.

1221.content:
Why is the younger Hawke sibling putting on the pounds?

1221.title: Bethany Hawke.

choices: Bethany goes to Gianna for help losing weight. It doesn’t go as expected.
Bethany continues to try and lose the weight on her own, with reverse results.
12212.content:
(Note: This Bethany’s appearance is that of when the default Hawke is selected.)

The money hadn’t come without struggles, but once again the Amells were nobility, and now the Hawkes were as well. They had returned to their ancestral home, and sat in the lap of luxury. What’s more, Gianna Hawke could also use the money she had earned as a shield to protect her ‘precious baby sister bird’, Bethany, from the prying eyes of Templars that would have the Mage placed in the Circle. If not worse for her long years of apostasy.

Gianna had always been extremely protective of Bethany, but ever since the death of Carver, the redhead rouge hardly ever let her sister out of her sight. Of course Bethany understood; Gianna placed the sole blame of his death on herself, and their mother only served to cement that idea in her mind, but it could become more than a little annoying. The only time she did in recent memory was during her expedition into the Deep Roads. The eldest Hawke sister insisted Bethany stay home with their mother and uncle, and keep her head down until she returned. Their were a few close calls with the Templars, but Bethany had stayed out of sight long enough to see her sister return, her pockets lined with ancient, valuable treasure.

Without the constant fear that the Templars would snatch her up the second she looked away, Gianna loosened the short leash she kept Bethany on. She was allowed to walk the streets of Hightown and Lowtown without her sister tagging along, though that didn’t apply to Darktown. Of course, no one went to Darktown alone. She’d visit Aveline at the keep, listen to Varric’s stories, and go shopping for hats with Isabela. In fact, now that she had money, Bethany would do lots of shopping. At first it was only at the behest of Varric, saying that she should be “frivolous with her wealth”, but it had become something that she greatly enjoyed. Sometimes on warm, clear days, she would spend the entire day browsing the markets. She’d buy herself anything from exquisite Orlisian dresses, to exotic Rivaini fruits. If it caught her attention, even for a moment, she’d purchase it for herself.

She never thought it possible that she would, but she actually felt like a proper noble woman. More than that, she actually liked it. One could even say her new lifestyle agreed with her as well. As she indulged in the decadent ways of a noble, pound after pound of soft pale fat had begun to creep onto her once trim form. The Mage tried adjusting her diet when she first noticed her gain, but ended up putting on even more weight when she began cheating on it. The fact she wasn’t regularly in life threatening situations that forced her to get a work out didn’t help her keep them off, either.

While every other girl she knew had firm, flat tummies, Bethany’s had become round and squishy, with soft pink stretch marks. There was no longer a gap between her thighs, and her hips had become too wide for her to sleep in a twin bed without feeling like she was going to fall out; thankfully that was no longer required since the moved out of Gamlin’s house. Even her face had become softer, with her cheeks becoming puffier, and her chin gaining a friend. The only upside she saw was that her bust and rear had grown to sizes that rivaled Isabela’s generous proportions, something the pirate was eager to point out.

Everyone in Gianna’s little group had made some comment or another about Bethany’s weight at that point, aside from Gianna herself, and Merrill, who seemed oblivious to it. Some of them were simple observations, like when Aveline pointed out how tight her clothes looked on her. Some were less so, such as when Sebastian recounted the verse of the Chant of Light that called gluttony abominable. Anders simply warned her of the health risks of having a high weight. Fenris was was just Fenris. She had taken to wearing baggier clothing when going out with them, and hiding away in her room when they came to visit to avoid hearing their comments. The entire thing was mortifying for her…
12212.title: Noble Sunshine.

1222.content:
How will the captain of the Kirkwall guard be gaining glorious weight?

1) Her promise to not lead from behind a desk falls flat.

2) Her grief over Ser Wesley's death causes her to fill the hole he left with food.

3) A patrol in Darktown goes wrong and she's shipped to Tevinter to be enslaved to a Magister that enjoys heftier women.
1222.title: Aveline

choices: Turns out Aveline may need more than a little time in the field to lose weight.
After some time, Aveline asks for Hawke’s help courting Ser Donic.
12221.content:
It had come to the point that if Aveline wanted to kill time, she could count the number of times she had counted the celling tiles in her office; the number of the former being far higher than that latter. It had been nearly, what? Three years since she became Guard Captain? It had been three years since Hawke’s expedition into the deep roads, and she had become Captain of the Guard a short while before that, so three years and a few months. And by the Maker was it boring. Aveline had assumed that Jeven hardly even left his office because he was lazy and corrupt, but there was actually a crippling amount of paper work that kept her trapped in her office most days. Most days she had to take her meals inside her office while going over reports. The only times she ever went out in the fields was when she went on one of Hawke’s ‘adventures’, and the last ‘adventure’ she went on was the Deep Roads Expedition… three years ago…

Three years of doing justice behind a desk had certainly had an effect on Aveline’s body. Her cheeks had filled out a second chin had formed under her first, rounding out her face. She had to have her armor modified several times as her stomach needed more and more room, and more and more space needed to be covered. She had even broken her desk chair just by sitting in it, and she wasn’t even wearing her armor! If Aveline had to guess she would say she had put on at least a hundred pounds, though she didn’t know since she hadn’t had the courage to step on one in over a year, when it told her she had gained seventy pound. She has seen recruits sign up larger than her and finish training thin and fit many times, and it embarrassed her greatly.

The idea of giving up the position so she could get back in the field and lose the weight, but she didn’t trust anyone else to be Guard Captain. It felt like she was going to spend the rest of her life behind this desk getting fatter and more out of shape until she was no longer fit to be a guard.

“Hello, hello~” Hawke greeted, knocking on the office door only after she had entered. It’d been far to long since Aveline saw the raven haired woman with crystal blue eyes, but it didn’t look like she had aged a day since they had first met. The rouge had a wide smile on her face that just screamed that she was about to get herself into trouble, or do something dangerous. No doubt Hawke would want Aveline to join in on whatever misadventures she was about to go on. And Aveline couldn’t have been happier to see it.

They made some small talk, first, of course. About Hawke’s new wealth. How Aveline was settling as Captain. The Viscount and the guards, the Templars. Just about everything except for Aveline’s added weight. Either Hawke didn’t notice, or she was too polite to bring it up, and both were unlikely. There must have been some other reason. However the topic of going out with her, Merrill, and Isabela came up, and she jumped (figuratively) at the opportunity to go with them before she figured out what it was.
12221.title: Aveline, the desk jockey.

choices: With Hawke’s help, Aveline starts to gain muscle, along with more fat.
Isabela sabotages Aveline, keeping her fat and out of commission.
122211.content:
Never before in her entire life had Aveline been so out of breath. Not only was she panting like a dog, but she was also sweating in hear heavy armor, and her aching, underused muscles were killing her. And all this after only a small skirmish with a handful of thugs! She used to eat punks like them for breakfast! Now, if it were’t for Isabela covering her back, she would have been completely overwhelmed.

“Looks like you’ve fallen out of practice, Big Girl. I suppose that means I can start stealing in front of you again.” The Swashbuckler teased the Guardian with a mischievous grin. Just like Hawke, Isabela had yet to say anything about Aveline’s weight. Sure, there were plenty of comments on how out of shape she was, on top of the normal jabs, but it seemed even she knew a woman’s weight was a touchy subject.

“Try it, whore, and I’ll have you clapped in irons!” Aveline threatened between labored breaths. She may not have been able to do it herself, but she could order another guard to do it for her. Though, it’s actions like that which are largely to blame for how out of shape she’d become. There were certainly times where she could have gone into the field, but there was always paperwork that needed to be done that she felt just couldn’t be pushed off. Though, she didn’t let that felling stop her from leaving with Hawke.

With an amused laugh, Isabela placed a hand on her jutting hip and looked at the Captain of the Guard. “You sure are eager to get me in cuffs, aren’t you? You could use a pair of mine if you like. Much more comfortable than the normal kind.”

“Shut up, whore.”

“Sorry, I never wear the gag.”

“Harlot!”

“Prude!”

“Sovereign!” Marian suddenly yelled excitedly, holding up the golden piece of currency triumphantly. Finally done with her looting, Hawke stood up from her crouched position over the body of the thug she found the coin on, then walked over to her three friends. “Looks like these fine men will be paying for our lunch!” She declared with a smile before wiping her enemies’ blood from her face.

Normally Aveline didn’t have much of an appetite after being splattered in very persistent gore, but today she had worked up a strong hunger fighting and lugging around her heavy armor. The thing was, Aveline felt like she’d end up taking in more calories than she burned if she ate now. “I think I’ll skip lunch today, if it’s all the same to you. Besides, I should be getting back to keep.” She doubted her legs even had the strength left in them to carry her there.

Hawke pouted. “Aww, but we haven’t even gone on our adventure yet!” The grown woman whined like a spoiled child, even stomping her foot in protest.

Isabela sashayed over to Hawke and draped her arm around her fellow rouge’s shoulders. “It’s probably for the best, sweet thing. She wouldn’t be able to keep up with us anyway.” The promiscuous pirate said, obviously trying to taunt Aveline into coming anyway. After all, how could she annoy her if she wasn’t there?

Aveline hung her head and sighed. “She’s right…”

“Atta girl, let’s—wait, I’m what?”

“Look at me!” Aveline cried out, gesturing to her body. “ I’m more out of shape than most nobles in Hightown. At best I’d slow you down, at worst I’d get you killed.”

Placing the sovereign into her purse, Hawke moved from Isabela over to Aveline, and placed a hand onto her shoulder. “It’s not that bad! With the right help you could get back to normal in no time!”

Aveline perked up. “Are you volunteering?”

Hawke held out her open palm. “You know I’m not.” Shaking her head but still smiling, Aveline placed a small pouch full of coins into Hawke’s hand. “Great! We’ll start right after lunch!”
122211.title: Aveline is really out of shape!

1222111.content:
“Come on, Aveline! Pick up the pace! I’ve seen toddlers waddle faster than you!” Martian berated her friend publicly as they walked the streets of Hightown. Hawke kept a paces in front of the over fed Captain of the Guard, jogging backwards so that she could keep an eye on her, practically taunting Aveline with her physical fitness while she was panting like an old Mabari. It didn’t help that she was lugging around her weight in “valuables” Hawke had picked up. What would anyone ever need with this many pairs of tattered pants?

“You know, when you said you would help me, I wouldn’t have agreed if I knew you were just going to make me carry your junk!” Aveline as she readjusted some of the things the noble was forcing her to carry.

Marian scowled at the ginger as she walked in reverse. “Hush, ye of little faith! The is simply endurance training! You paid me to help you get back in shape, and by Andraste’s thong, I always do what I’m paid to!” Sometimes Aveline wondered if Hawke was the same kind of Andrastian as Varric, or if she simply liked the sounds of the blasphemous turns of phrase. “Plus, you’re my best friend, so I’m at least doubly obligated to help you.” And with that comment, Aveline was red in the face from more than being out of breath.

Hawke may have been greedy, money-grubbing, penny-pincher, but her friends still meant more to her than gold. She just preferred it when she could make money helping them. There were actually several occasions where she asked for money to do a job, was denied coin, then went ahead and helped anyway. She also had at least some morals, as she would never steal (except from criminals and those so rich they would never notice) and wouldn’t kill for coin (unless they really deserved). All things considered, Aveline would have to say Hawke at least tried to be a half decent person.

“Hey, bubble butt! Get your head out of the clouds! If we don’t get to the market before they close and I get a chance to hock all this crap, I’m going to make you run another three laps!”

Hawke’s “endurance training” only happened two other time, all ending with Hawke treating to a hearty meal. After that, the real workouts began. Hawke used some of the money she got from pawning her junk to buy some training equipment, and turned an unused room at her estate into a training room. Every day, Aveline would come to Hawke’s home, and she would be treated to a substantial amount of food to fuel her through the twenty lunges, jumping jacks, and windmill stretches that would immediately follow. All of that would just be a warm up for the exercises to come. The first day Marian had the obese former soldier go at a punching bag for twenty minutes without rest just as a start; her freckled cheeks red the entire time from the sensation of her loose arm fat and belly bulge wobbling about with each punch.

No two workout sessions were the same, but they were always brutal, exceedingly physically demanding, and followed up by a large meal with the Hawke family. At first Aveline thought Hawke was just torturing her, until she saw the results. Her once loose flab gained firmness, no longer wobbling as much when she moved. The muscles that had been lost beneath excess flesh began to reappear. Armor she had outgrown fit her better. Best of all, she no longer became winded easily. In fact, though she would never admit it, Hawke’s endurance training seemed to have worked, and now she felt like she had more energy to burn than even before she put on weight. Never before had she felt such confidence in herself, or her abilities. She even felt good enough to…
1222111.title: AVELINE STRONG!

1223.content: The Dalish Pariah, the Swashbuckler, or the Qunari Elf Assassin?
1223.title: Merrill, Isabela, or Tallis?

choices: Merrill resists the demon, and goes to get that darn bread.
Merrill gets possessed/makes a deal with the demon.
12231.content:
(Warning: self harm via blood magic.)

Despite what her clan, or Anders, or Fenris, or anyone else thought of her, Merrill was not stupid. She did not misuse blood magic. She could not be tempted by any demon, like one aforementioned broody Elf. All schools of magic can be mastered, and Merrill had performing blood magic down to a science. Taking a dagger from her side and putting it against her already scared left wrist, she gently applied just enough pressure to cut the skin, Merrill the brought the dagger across the width of her wrist to get the desired amount of blood. She needed the perfect amount; having to account for the difference in the power of blood and lyrium. When she had enough she bandaged her arm to keep blood from going where it wasn’t supposed to. It would likely heal by the time she was done with the ritual.

Using her blood to power her magic, she began to repair the Eluvian. She had to keep her mind clear and emotions in check, or else she might attract the unwanted attention of demons. Feeling happiness with her progress could attract a powerful Pride demon. Wanting it to be done could attract a Desire demon. Frustration with the slow pace: Rage. Get tired? Sloth. Anxious? Fear. She had some trouble before, but nothing she couldn't’t handle, and this time Merrill had accounted for everything, and was sure no demons would bother her this—groooowwl. Had she forgotten to eat today?

You hunger… Came a low, brooding, sinister disembodied voice. Many in this place hunger…

Merrill knew it was a Hunger demon. It made itself very obvious that was what it was, but she also recognized the voice and presence of it from the one Hawke’s party had encountered in the Deep Roads. She immediately stopped the ritual to keep it from fully breaking through the Veil while it was weak, and to keep from attracting any other demons. “It’s fine. I’ll go to the market and get some bread later.” Merrill said, trying to dismiss the demon. It would leave her alone if it didn’t think it could tempt her with food or cunsomption.

Bread? Flour, water, yeast; mixed together and baked. So simple, so dull, and it is what you and many in this place have every day. If you have anything at all. Don’t you want more? You could all have so much more…


All the Elves in the Alienage were fairly poor, and some days would go without eating, and this demon knew it. There was the possibility that it had always lingered here, pressing against the other side of the Veil, and all of Merrill’s magic had only made it weaker. “Oh, no, really, bread is fine. I like to watch it rise when they bake it. It makes me think of a big brown wave rising over the horizon.” If she could get the subject far enough away from hunger and food the demon would lose interest and go. Then her stomach growled again.

Bread is such a deceitful food. It gets bigger, promising you more food, but it fills itself with empty space. Don’t be like bread. Don’t let yourself be filled up by EMPTY space. FILL YOURSELF.

Merrill put her hands against her head over her ears, pressing against it hard. She could feel the demon clawing, digging, and worming away at her mind, trying to get her to do what it wanted. The constant sound of her belly grumbling for food didn’t help either. “That’s good…I don’t want to eat too much…” Merrill struggled to speak her own words.

Too much? There is NO SUCH THING. These are things you and the others in this place tell yourselves. That something is enough. That something is too much. There is only more. And MORE. AND MORE. AND MOOOORE!!! Why not have more? Won’t you let yourself have more? Don’t you deserve it? To be full? To have more?
12231.title: Merrill and the Hunger demon

123.content: Which party member are you going for?
123.title: (Cassandra, Sera, Vivienne)

choices: Going back to live a royal life (neutral approval)
Becomes overly pampered by the Inquisition (positive approval)
1231.content: Right hand of the Inquisition, how will the reluctant heir to the Nevarran Throne pack on the pounds?
1231.title: Cassandra

choices: The people come first. Cassandra is well liked and gains at an average rate.
Stability comes first. Cassandra is hated and gains rapidly.
12311.content:
It was a tragedy. It truly was. The mysterious plague came and went through in less than two months, claiming thousands upon thousands of Nevarrans, and all but erasing the Pentaghast bloodline. It was highly suspect how quickly the next in line to the throne attempted to claim it after the plague had passed. Rumors ceculated that he had caused the plague to usurp the throne, but all attention shifted away from him when another successor was discovered. Vladimir Pentaghast—the ‘usurper’—was one hundred twenty-third in line to the throne, while Cassandra Pentaghast, who was serving the Inquisition at the time of the plague, was seventy-eighth in line.

Cassandra was promptly brought back to Nevarra, and, however begrudgingly, was made queen of the devastated country. Leadership was needed, and no mater her distaste for her countrymen, she was the only one fit to offer it, and she knew it. So she sat on the throne her distant relatives once sat upon and presided over the people through the harsh times of recovery.

She still helped the Inquisiton, offering aid whenever she could, but Cassandra’s main focus was on restoring order in Nevarra, so she could hopefully return one day. However, the people were not making it easy. The simplest caugh would cause mass panic, the people frightful of the plague returning. They were all to caught up in being paranoid to rebuild. Agricultural took a serious hit, with entire fields being burned to eliminate infestations of plague spreading rats. Trade came to screeching halt with merchants to afraid to come and go. The healers and surgeons were too afraid to treat people out of fear the plague still remained. In short, Nevarra was in bad condition and was only getting worse; the country was facing collapse.

The worst part was that the few people who were doing something about the state of living in Nevarra were only trying to restore the way of life for the nobility. While the rich and powerful mostly went back to life as normal, the common folk were dying out due to preventable disease, and famine. The Inquisition returned Cassandra’s favors by lending her some much needed support, but it was up to her on what it would be used on. Her first act as Queen of Nevarra would be to Use the support to resolve one of two issues: relief efforts for the common people, or restoring agriculture and trade.

If the support was used to help the common people, food, medicine, and other essentials would be brought in by the Inquisition, slowing recovery, but very few would die. (Estimated death toll: a few dozen. Popularity: 25/200 Rate of weight gain: average. Nevarra’s stability: 5%.

If the support was used to restore agriculture and trade, the Inquisition would work the fields and do the trading for Nevarra, speeding up recovery, at the cost of many lives. (Estimated death toll: eight thousand. Popularity: 5/200 Rate of weight gain: rapid. Nevarra’s stability: 20%.
12311.title: Queen Cassandra. Ugh. (AKA Plague Ex Machina)

choices: Herah leaves Cassandra to spiral further.
Herah tries to sober up the pudgy Seeker.
12312.content:
Cassandra burst into a coughing fit as some to her mead went down the wrong pipe from her drinking too much too fast. She dizzily raised her arms into the air while she coughed, still holding her half emptied jug in her hand. When the fit ended, she went right back to drinking. This was her… some high numbered flagon of some kind of alcohol that day. Her belly was full and heavy, and sloshed about even when she hand’t been been binge drinking. Cassandra had taken to drinking to deal with her anger, and as a result had not only become a bit of a drunk, but she also gained a beer belly that noticeable even when she was fully armored.

“Damn pointy eared, mage-coddling, Chantry hating, heathen oxwoman!” The once proud warrior ranted as she stumbled around the smithy. “I am the one who—hic—I am more important than her! Andraste should have chosen me!” Her raving could be heard outside the smithy even over the banging of hammers. She was about to storm out to go give the Inquisitor a piece of her mind, but she could no longer keep her balance and fell into a pile of sacks, causing her spherical belly to shake like jelly.

She stayed in the spot for some time, simply drinking her troubles away, until her troubles came into the smithy. When she saw the Inquisitor approaching, she began yet another one of her alcohol fulled rants.

“You’re angry at me? Is that what this is about?” Herah asked after Cassandra had finished, offering a sarcastic toast to her ‘holiness’ at the end.

“Naturally! Isn’t everything about you?” Cassandra slurred, both her thoughts and speech impaired by her inebriation.

Herah crossed her arms and knitted her brow. “What have you got to be angry about?”

With more than a little effort, Cassandra gets herself back onto her feet, wobbling back and forth slightly to keep her balance, her bulging belly adding to the difficulty of the task. “You!” She began, pointing an unsteady finger at Herah. “Coddling the mages, encouraging them as if they didn’t almost cost us everything! I have watched you, even exalted you as you straddled the world. And I’m the one who raised you up.”

“I’m doing the best I can, Cassandra. ‘What needs to be done’. Remember?”

Cassandra shakes her head. “I do remember.” She throws her flagon away while maintaining eye contact with Herah, then turns away. “Corypheus still lives. My work is not yet done…” She shambles over to a wall and leaned against it. “Leave me be, Inquisitor. Go, do what must be done…”
12312.title: Speaker Casserole Pentupgas. (Drunk Cassandra.)

choices: Cassandra tries to exercise to lose the weight.
She ignores it for now, and decides to visit her old friends at the Inquisition.
12313.content:
After a few months upon the Sunburst Throne, Cassandra Pentaghast, now known as Divine Victoria, had been rebuilding the Andrastian Chantry piece by piece. She had made reforms to it and declared the Inquisition, now the most powerful force in the South, a friendly party. She was, however, an oddity compared to past Divines. She practiced with her sword in the courtyard of her residence and often walked about the grounds wearing her armor. She did not let the power of leading the Chantry go to her head, but she did enjoy the banquet-like feasts that she presided over quite commonly....

"What do you mean there's no more food?!" Pentaghast shouted at an Elven servant, the plate in front of her clear, and the long table rid of the food that once covered it. The entirety of the people at the table watched in awe as she glared at the lithe, pointy-eared girl, while Cassandra's very noticeable potbelly stretched the fabric of her garments.

"Th-the food's all g-gone, Most Holy... Y-you ate the last of it...." The servant said, cowering in fear.

Casandra slammed her fist on the table, drawing the whole room to silence. "That is unacceptable! I demand that you bring me more at once!"

The Elf bowed in a rushed manner, then scurried off to the kitchen.

The portly Divine scoffed, then noticed the whole room staring at her in silence, from the Templar Knights guarding the doors to the masked Orlesian nobles. She blushed brightly, then growled. "What are you all looking at?!" She demanded.

They all looked away and started talking amongst themselves.

Cassandra looked down to shake her head, then noticed the bulge that protruded from her figure where her flat stomach once resided. She gasped quietly, having only just noticed this. She looked around nervously, then bolted up from her chair and dashed out the door. She sped by the same Elf that she previously yelled at, who was carrying a platter of food.

"Most Holy! Your food!" She called to the Divine.

Divine Victoria sputtered. "Deliver it to my chambers!" She called back before continuing down the hall.

She ran until she reached her quarters. She opened the door, went in ,and slammed it shut. Once inside, she put her hands on her knees and panted to catch her breath.

"This... *pant* is just... *pant* disgraceful!" She said, then fell backwards onto her soft bed, just before someone knocked on the door. "Who is it?!"

"A s-servant... I've got your food..."

Cassandra's strong desire to cram her mouth full of food forced her up. She opened the door, snatched the food from the servant, then slammed the door and locked it. Since she was now all alone, she stripped down to just her undergarments, her bra tight around her slightly bigger breasts, and her panties barely covering her softer backside.

"How did I allow this to happen?" Cassandra asked herself as she looked at herself in the full-body mirror. She then noticed her sword, shield, and armor, which were collecting dust in the corner of her room, the platter of food that sat at the end of her bed, the sweet roll in her hand. "Oh... that explains everything...." She said guiltily.
12313.title: Divine Victoria

choices: “You look great!” Herah thinks her added pudge is a good look for Cassandra.
“You got fat!” Herah agrees that Cassandra should lose weight.
123132.content:
Soldiers stood in attention as Cassandra passed through the front gate of Skyhold, their heads bowed in respect of the new Devine. Some of the soldiers she knew from when she served in the Inquisistion, but looked at her now as if she was an entirely different person; and perhaps she was now. With a new name, position, and responsibilities that dwarfed anything she was ever tasked with before, Cassandra Pentaghast and Devine Victoria shared little more than a past, body, and mind. Even the physical resemblance were starting to fade as Cassandra’s figure filled out. While not quite fat yet, there is far more meat on her body now than there ever had been before; pleasantly plump is what one of the servant girls had once called her. It is one of the of the more pleasant things she was called behind her back…

Cassandra’s thoughts are taken off of her size when the familiar form of her greatest friend approaches; Inquisitor Herah Adaar. Wearing a smile that goes from ear to ear, the Qunari woman bows to Cassandra as well, although in a more showy and comedic fashion. Vashoth, Cassandra reminds herself. Even after spending so much time with the gray skinned giant, she still makes the mistake more often than she wild like to admit. While Cassandra has gotten quite out of shape, Herah is still just as fit as ever; her tight muscles straining her ugly green unde-armor.

“Cassandr, so good to see you!” The woman with goat-like horns greets, her elation audibal on her voice. Forgoing any other pleasantries one would show the Devine, Herah hurries over to Cassandra to lift the shorter woman up in a hug.“It’s been too long!”

The Former Seeker’s cheeks tinge crimson as she is suspended in the air by her best friend. “It is good to see you, too, my friend.” She replies with a suppressed laugh. “Though I could do without you crushing my ribs…” She finishes with a pained grunt.

Putting the former Seeker of Truth down, the woman with ram-like horns blushes as well. “Heh, sorry, you know how excited I can get.” Herah apologizes, rubbing the back of her head. With over Herah takes a moment to look the new Devine up a down. “Wow, Cass,” Herah begins, then finishes with…
123132.title: A different person.

choices: "and I would love to be your guest of honor." Cassandra goes to the feast
"but I'm afraid I cannot accept." Cassandra retires to her temporary quarters
1231321.content:
Cassandra couldn't help but look at her horned friend incredulously. Herah caught wind of Cassandra's skepticism and felt the need to explain herself.
"Cass, did you forget where I come from?" she said through a half cracked smile. She continued, "Qunari have always thought that women should have a carry a little more pudge than other races. It looks good on you." Herah leaned forward and poked Cassandra's small potbelly.
Cassandra's cheeks flushed red and she quickly swatted Herah's hand away.
"I'd appreciate it if you didn't make my - small weight gain - so obvious," she said as she tried to reclaim her dignity.
Herah shrugged and removed her hand. She gestured towards the main hall and they made their way through Skyhold's courtyard.
"We've made quite a few improvements to Skyhold's defenses while you were away." Herah pointed pointed up at nearby tower, "We've even installed some new trebuchets and ballistas."
Cassandra stared open mouthed at Skyhold's new defenses and marveled at their tactical proficiency.
Herah laughed at Cassandra's incredulous stare and continued, "And to celebrate all of our hard work, we will be holding a feast and I would like you to be my guest of honor."
Cassandra stopped in her tracks. "Oh," she said, "that's very kind of you . . . "
1231321.title: “You look great!” Herah thinks her added pu...

choices: Cassandra respects the tradition and tastes every single plate
Cassandra rejects the tradition and only her own plate
12313211.content:
"That's awesome!" Herah beamed. She beckoned for a guard, "Show the Most Holy to my quarters. That will be her temporary quarters for the duration of her stay."
"Yes, Inquisitor," the guard said and offered a salute.
Herah turned back to Cassandra, "Spruce yourself up a little. There's going to be a lot of Orlaesian dignitaries so try to look proper." With that, Herah took her leave and walked towards a group of recruits yelling incomprehensible tips and criticisms.
"This way, my lady," said the guard as he led Cassandra through Skyhold's great hall. Servants were scurrying about setting up tables and sweeping the dirt from the hall. There was even a servant high on the rafters shooing birds that have made their nests in the hall's high ceiling. At then end of the hall, servants were cleaning Herah's throne. It was a large throne and its design was heavily influenced by Herah's Qunari background. It was impressive and intimidating.
The guard ushered Cassandra the rest of the way to the Inguisitor's quarters.
"A servant will come to fetch you once the preparations are complete. In the mean time, the Inquisitor has requested that you dress formally." The guard bowed and took his leave. Cassandra sighed and began rummaging through her many trunks for something to wear.


Cassandra was still getting the hang of the whole "dressing formally" thing but she managed to pull together a nice dress. She looked herself over in the mirror.
"Oh how I hate this thing," she said as she tugged here and there. "I'll have to have a word with my seamstress. She sewed another dress that's too small again." Cassandra pulled at the middle of her dress as her potbelly squeezed it tightly.
After fussing over her dress, a knock came at the door.
"M'lady, it's time for the feast. I will guide you to your seat at the Inquisitor's right hand."
Cassandra sighed once more, "Let's get this over with."


Once she arrived at the great hall, she was greeted by a deluge of foreign nobles and noblewomen. They chatted in little cliques mostly likely gossiping about the noble right next to them. Cassandra couldn't stand them. While she walked to her seat, the nobles began noticing her and bowed respectfully until she took her seat next to Herah.
Herah leaned over, "Talkative bunch aren't they?"
"Perhaps a little too much," Cassandra replied. Herah smiled and rose.
"Lords and ladies," her voice boomed, "Welcome to Skyhold. You will have no doubt heard of our triumph over Corypheus and his minions. It was a great victory but it was not without its losses. So today, we celebrate that victory and we celebrate Skyhold's newest rise as the most formidable fortress in all of Thedas. So without further adue, LET THE FEAST BEGIN!"
On que, servants poured out of the kitchens bearing platters large and small. They expertly placed platters on each and every table and in front of each person.
Cassandra was taken aback by the shear amount of food Herah had acquired. The servants lifted the lids off the platters and all sorts of foods were revealed. Cassandra's mouth began to water.
"Now before we begin," Herah started, "It is customary that our guest of honor should taste each meal before it is passed along." Cassandra's eyes widened.
"Every single one?" she asked Herah.
Herah laughed at her clueless friend, "Yes, Cass, every single one." A servants hands her the first plate and . . .
12313211.title: "and I would love to be your guest of honor...

choices: She sleeps through the night, and wants to try to lose weight in the morning.
Herah accidentally wakes Cassandra in the middle of the night.
123132111.content:
Full. So painfully and thoroughly full. Cassandra tasted every. Last. Plate. She lost count after the first twenty, and on top of it all she still had her own meal to eat. At one point the Inquisitor had to come in and feed her when she was too full to do it herself. As forkful after forkful was forced into her gullet the Divine began to feel more stuffed than the roasted stuffed pig; of which she sampled more than her fair share.

Roasted nug melted in her mouth. Succulent druffalo stake with thick, tangy sauce was chewed thoroughly. Freshwater fish from lake Calenhad seasoned with lemon pepper. Soft breads. Assorted cheeses. Juicy fruits and fresh vegetables. Eggs, rice, meat pies, corn, caviar, beans—all the different foods became too much for her and it soon became an orgy of divine, changing flavors moving over her tongue and into her overfull stomach.

When all the tasting was done Cassandra was allowed to test while the other, apparently less honorable guests began to stuff themselves. Her one tight dress was much less constricting on her belly, because several tears had formed, taking the pressure off of it. The former Seeker of Truth couldn’t even think about eating anything else while her belly pulsated with pain, however the Inquisitor would remind Cassandra every other minute that she still had her own food to eat.

“It’s going to get cold!” She chided her. “If you don’t eat dinner you won’t get dessert!” She spoke as if she was a doting mother. “There are starving people in the Anderfels!” After that Cassandra starting eating on instinct, shoveling even more food into her strained belly against her will. She just couldn’t help herself. The sensation was indescribably painful, but almost orgasmic at the same time.

Like too many times before, Cassandra ate like she was possessed by a hunger demon, not stopping until there was no food left, and, again, like too many times before, demanded more food. The nobles attending the feast had all heard rumors of Divine Victoria’s monstrous appetite, but seeing it in action was another thing. Reactions to her feasting ranged from disgust, to embarrassment, laughter, shame, and possibly even arousal.

By the time Cassandra finally had her fill, the other guests had already been finished for quite a while. Leliana thought it best to remove Cassandra before people could begin to talk, taking her up to Herah’s room with the excuse of needing to speak with her about Chantry maters. As the Left Hand to the Divine, everyone one believed the excuse, or at least if they didn’t were smart enough not to say anything.

When placed upon the Inquisitor’s soft bed, Cassandra immediately fell into a deep food coma, and Leliana was unable to rouse her. After spending enough time waiting in the room long enough for them to have an important conversation, Leliana descended the stairs and rejoined the festivities. She informed everyone that the Divine had retired for the night, having been worn out by her long trip to Skyhold.
123132111.title: A Feast of Feasts

choices: Cassandra starts to feel something else in her belly. Butterflies.
Sera interupts them, insisting on a sleep over.
1231321112.content:
It would not only unfair but inaccurate to label all Qunari as large, uncoordinated, ox-men simply because of their size. Some could be very stealthy and agile. The Inquisitor was not one of them. She had only wanted to sneak in her room to grab something that was totally not something cuddly and bear-shaped before sneaking back out without waking the sleeping woman in her bed. Instead, she stumbled around in the dark, bumping into just about everything except what she was looking for. It didn’t take much for Cassandra to be woken up by Herah with her waking so much noise. However, unable to see who was fumbling about in the dark, the former Seeker of Truth reached for the blade she would usually keep beneath her pillow only to find it absent. She must have been too full to remember to place it there before passing out, she realized. Still, Cassandra was not going to be taken off guard by the potential threat, which was actually her best friend.

Even though several forces such as gravity, her still over-full belly, and her tiredness were working against her, Cassandra managed to get herself up and tackle the figure cloaked in shadow. Both women went down, landing on the floor with a thud, and the much heavier of the two landing on top of the other. All of the air in Herah’s lungs was forced out with a pained groan as she felt her body practically get flattened. At the very least none of her bones were broken by the impact, though a little more force and a few extra pounds would have lead to a very different outcome. “Who are y—oh, Maker!” Cassandra began to yell, but now that she was up close to the “intruder”, and her eyes had had some time to adjust to the dark, she could see that she was crushing the life out of the Inquisitor. She quickly began scrambling together off of her horned friend before she caused her any permanent damage. “Herah, are you okay?! I am so sorry, I did not know it was you!” The Divine asked with great concern once she was off Herah and on her plump behind.

Sitting up with a pained groan, the Vashoth woman replied, “It’s fine, I’m fine. My insides needed a good ironing, anyway.” She chuckled with a smile. “Better safe than sorry, especially now that you’re so important. Not that you haven’t always been important, but now you need body guards.” It was very endearing how hard Herah tried to be polite, with only truly despicable people earning her ire. That combined with her sincerity and sheepishness off the battle field added to her cuteness. That, and her cute face.

1232.title: Sera

12321.content:
After the Inquisition had successfully defeated Corypheus and sealed the breach in the sky, Thedas was finally at peace. Cassandra had left to become Divine and Solas had disappeared, but there was no threat that they would need to fight. The Inquisition had wiped out every potential threat in both Ferelden and Orlais, so the Inquisition was able to take a break to catch their breaths. All of the warriors, mages and rogues trained and kept in shape for if another threat happened to pop up. All... except for Sera...

"Come on, you shite-y pants! Fit!" Sera exclaimed as she struggled to heave her pants past the paunch that was where her once-flat stomach resided. She pulled and pulled until the pants finally fit, but just barely. "There you go, now just to button them..." She used all her strength to pull the button close to the hole and got them together. "Finally!" She grabbed a jar of cookies off of her shelf and sat down on the couch. She took the lid off and started to eat the baked treats, rubbing her pale-skinned belly as she did. She ate until she could feel the button of her pants pushing into her stomach. She decided to ignore her tightening pants and shoved another cookie in her gob. Right after she swallowed, the button popped and flew across the room, hitting the door. She sighed, defeated. "I really am a fatass..." She said under her breath.

Just then, Inquisitor Lavellan, Sera's lover, walked in and her jaw dropped at the sight of the blonde elf's belly.

"Oh, tits!" Sera scrambled to cover up her stomach.

Lavellan hadn't seen Sera lately, as she'd been busy meeting with a lot of nobles in Val Royeaux and didn't know about her recent gain. She could only manage to say one word, which was...
12321.title: Cookies, yeah?

"Hot!" Inquisitor Lavellan immediately covered her mouth, realizing what she said, "I-I mean... Hello Sera..." She kept her mouth covered, doing little to conceal the crimson blush she was trying to hide.

"Hello, yeah! But what was that first bit?" Sera continued to hold the pillow she was using as cover.

"Oh, that? It was nothing." The Inquisitor feigned ignorance, "Care to share a seat? We haven't seen one another in a while..." The elf did her best to change the subject, cursing her slip of tongue.

Sara nodded slowly, narrowing her eyes. "So you were off talking with the stuffy gits, yeah?" She rolled with it, patting the seat next to her.

"Mhmm, the last place I've been wanting to visit, believe me," Lavellan sighed, leaning back on the couch, "Boring but necessary." She turned to Sara with a smile, "And I bet you've been busy?" Her grin widened a bit, seeing how far she could push it.

"Been doin a bit of this an that, yea." She made a grab for a cookie, "Been practicing bakin and stuff... You know, since last time we had cookies an all." Sara tried taking a stab at evasion as well, not wanting to admit her blatant binging.

"Mmm, I can see that!" Lavellan nudged in closer, poking Sara in her obviously softer flank. "Baking, huh?" She stuck out her tongue, face still red with blush. "Don't worry though, I dont mind." She said confidently, grabbing a cookie to nibble on. "I think you're looking better now than before."

"Oi, if you're jokin, it ain't funny!" Sara crossed her arms over her noticeably larger chest.

"Heh, I swear! I always thought you looked a bit thin is all..." Inquisitor Lavellan cooed, nudging in closer.

"Hmmm... I dunno..." Sara looked away a moment, snacking on a cookie subconsciously. "I'll admit, I've been snack in on cookies while you were gone an all, but..." Sara was cut off by a a shushing finger coming against her lips.

"Shhh, but nothing!" She smiled, "We won! You deserve some relaxation!" Lavellan reassured her love with a playful punch to the shoulder, "And just so you know, the first word I said was 'Hot'..." The elf giggled, giving up on the games.

Sara slowly relinquished the pillow, handing it to Lavellan slowly. "You sure about that? I'm still not sure..."
123211.title: I Like What I See!

1232111.content:
“I promise you, I'm telling the truth!” Lavellan said and set the pillow aside.

Sera continually crammed cookies in her mouth subconsciously, talking while chewing. “Prove it, then.”

The Inquisitor took Sera's hand in hers. “Why would I lie to you, sweetheart? I may kill people a lot, but I'm not cruel.”

Sera sighed. “Yeah, I s'pose that makes a dab a' sense.” She went to put another cookie in her mouth, but her hand hit the bottom of the jar. “Tits! I'm out already?” She handed the jar to Lavellan and a sheet of paper. “This is my recipe for cookies. Go an' fill the jar up for me, yeah?”

Lavellan smiled and got up. “It'd be an honor.” She pecked Sera on the lips and poked her belly, then went off to Skyhold's kitchen, where she made two batches of cookies for her chubby elven lover. She filled up the jar and hurried back to the Tavern, where she found Sera's door locked. She knocked twice. “It's me.” She said.

Sera immediately opened the door and pulled Lavellan inside, then shut the door and locked it once more. She snatched the jar out of the Dalish elf's hands and stowed the recipe on her shelf. “Thanks, love.” Sera kissed her cheek and sat back down on her couch, then began eating the fresh batch of cookies.

Lavellan sat next to her and rubbed her chubby belly. “You look so adorable.”

Sera blushed, then looked down at her belly, which hung out of her pants that had previously busted open. “It's gonna be real friggin' awkward getting new pants from the tailor….”

“Oh, don't be silly! I'll handle that for you, sweetheart.” The Inquisitor got up and left Sera alone in her room once more.

Sera got up, jar in arm, and looked at her reflection in the window glass. She hadn't yet taken time to think about whether or not she liked her gain. She looked over herself: chubby cheeks, armpit fat coming out of her top, bigger boobs, and a belly….

1312122.content:
The only sound that could be heard in massive and empty dining hall was the sound of Elissa rapping her fingers on the table. At the other side of the needlessly long table sat her wife, Anora, eating her dinner in silence. Elissa had already finished her food, in record time in fact, but figured she’d stick around to keep Anora company. Even if they weren’t close, Elissa didn’t think that a person should be alone in such a big space.

Slowly, one after another, Anora raised spoonfuls of stew up to her mouth. Up and down. Up and down. Tap-tap-tap-tap. Tap-tap-tap-tap. Tap-tap-tap-tap.

“We can talk to each other, you know.” Anora said, suddenly breaking the silence. She usually never said anything when it was just them.

Elissa almost jumped out of her chair from the sudden outburst. At least that was what it felt like with how quiet it was. “O-oh, I didn’t—”

Anora ‘tsked’ and look down at your stew, moving the pieces of meat and vegetables around in it with her spoon. “Of course you didn’t. You never do.” Elissa heard that a lot.

With a drained sigh, Elissa leaned back in her chair. “Look, I know we don’t love each other, I know this is all for show, and I know we have a sordid past together. I don’t, however, know why that means we can’t get along.”

“Neither do I, yet here we are. Struggling with small talk. I may be your wife and you may be mine but we do not belong to each other. No one is making you sit across from me.”

“I’m making me sit here! You know why? Because I’m a decent person who cares about other people!”

“Oh, and I’m not?”

“I didn’t—”

“Of course you didn’t. You never do.”

Once again the room fell into complete silence. The estranged couple simply staring back at each other. A minute passed and Anora resumed eating. Two minutes later Elissa started tapping her rapping her fingers on the table again. Up and down the spoon went. Up and down. Up and down. Tap-tap-tap-tap. Tap-tap-tap-tap. Tap-tap-tap-tap.

“Should I have died instead of your father?” Elissa said, staring down at her empty plate. “I could have made the sacrifice instead of him.”

Anora was quiet for some time, and Elissa assumed that Anora hadn’t heard her, and was grateful out of fear of the answer. Then, “No.” She answered. “My father’s crimes… he could never have atoned for them in life. I hate that this is the way it had to be, but this is the way it had to be.”

Elissa cracked a half smile. “Well, at least we both prefer a world where I’m still alive.” She almost couldn’t believe it, but that actually got a laugh out of Anora.

“Yes, I suppose we do.” Anora replied, looking down so that Elissa couldn’t see her smiling.

Reaching forward toward the middle of the table, Elissa grabbed herself another dinner roll. She took a bite out of it, chewed, and swallowed. “Enjoying your stew?” She asked. This was the closest they had ever come to an actual conversation that wasn’t in the public eye.

Ferelden needed a leader. Loghain was dead. Alastair wanted to stay with the Wardens. They didn’t trust Anora to rule alone. So, Elissa offered to rule beside her. She was of noble birth, and was going to save Thedas from the Blight. Eamon spoke on her behalf, vouching for her noble deeds to save both his family, and all of Redcliff. So it was decided that they would be wed, and jointly rule the kingdom. Elissa didn’t think that Anora actually needed supervision, and trusted her to rule on her own, but this was the only way she could rule at all.

In public they played the part of the loving couple; holding hands, sharing the occasional kiss, but when they were alone they were little more than perfect strangers. “I’m not exactly a fan, but it tastes good enough.”

Elissa had eaten another two dinner rolls by this point. Her dress began to squeeze her tight around the belly, but that was nothing new. Since the wedding, Elissa had been packing on the pounds since she spent most of her time lazing around the castle. “I know I’m just a princess-consort, but do you think I have the authority to have this table switched for one that’s more practical? I mean I can hardly see you from over here.”

“You can be very persuasive.”

“Think I could persuade you to push our beds together tonight?” It was a silly question, since they didn’t even sleep in the same part of the castle, let alone the same room, and the answer was always no.

“Not tonight.” Anora answered.

13312.content:
Face down a horde of demons to close a rift? Sure. Foil an ancient Magister’s plans at every turn? Easy. Find and slay three High Dragons in a single afternoon? Child’s play. Flirt with an adorable woman with an accent that sounds like how honey tastes? Now that’s just impossible. At least it is for Ellana Lavellan. Just the thought of the ambassador brought a blush to the typically collected Elf’s face. Talking to her like a normal person was fine, but when she opened her mouth to say something romantic, and all that would come out would be a jumbled mesh of Elvish and the Common Tongue. She wanted to be with her more than anything, but the only way she could show her affection was by, well, not being anywhere near her. Whenever she had the chance, Ellana would sneak into Josephine’s office and leave gifts for her. However, though she didn’t what they did like, she did know that a Human would like what the Dalish would consider a gift. So, she went with the only thing she knew Josephine did like: sweets.

In fact, Ellana is leaving another one of these treats for Josephine on her desk while she spoke with the other advisors at this very moment. Until she hears footsteps coming from the war room, that is. Panicking, Ellana drops the basket of decedent pastries and bolts for the main hall, chastising herself for her cowardice as she runs.

When Josephine enters to see the basket on the floor with the red ribbon her secret admire tied to gifts they left, the Antivan woman can’t help but sigh. One hand goes to her stomach as she picks up the basket. Though her stomach had never been rock hard like Cassandra or Lelliana’s, it had also never been as soft as it was now, either. The once flat, smooth surface marred only by the scar of her navel is now a round, squishy orb with stretch marks caused by its rapid growth. The rest of her body had softened considerably (her thighs are so close to touching, now…) it was her stomach that was expanding fastest, likely due to her stuffing it full of sugary treats so often. The damage is far from irreversible at this point. A few weeks exercise would have her back down to size in just a few weeks. Provided she lay off the sweets, that is.

Placing the basket down on her desk, Josephine inspects the pastries inside. They look to be largely undamaged…perfectly fit for consumption…
13312.title: A Show of Affection.

133122.content:
The one bite was divine to the ambassador, who rationalized that it would be folly to waste food like this. So she took another, and another, and still more as she sent missive after missive until, after a few hours of good honest work, the basket was empty and Josephine was stuffed.

"Ugh," the Antivan groaned out, "I really must...erp...oh my...stop eating so much." But she was interrupted from her recrimination by a light knock on the door, one Josephine recognized and had started to long for since she recognized just who it belonged to. "Come in."

It was the Inquisitor and Josephine felt like the fattest swine in the market when faced with the lovely woman's dark eyes and petite frame. "Hello Josephine, I just wanted to ensure that you are doing alright."

"I am quite fine, your Worship, I was just finishing some work," Josephine replied, doing her utmost not to vent another belch in front of the elf she had long held a torch for. But would such a lovely creature want to be with an utter glutton like her?

Ellana, no the Inquisitor, Josephine reminded herself, approached her then, a happy smile on her face. "I see you got my treats." The smile vanished from the elf's face as she held up her hands. "That is to say I didn't...I mean...oh dread wolf take me, I have been sending you those baskets of goodies all this time!" The Inquisitor's face was now looking at the floor.

Josephine stared at the elf and got to her feet, moving slowly around her desk until she was fully facing the younger woman. Her guts gurgled, her taut middle rounding out her frilly dress, but Josephine ignored the discomfort and gently reached out with her hand and lifted the Inquisitor's chin. "Since revelations are coming to light this evening, I also wish to confess to you, Ellana Lavellen, that I-what is that? Is that...my family's old standard?" Ellana nodded and Josephine took the item from the Inquisitor's hand, fingers running over the item. "You did this...for me?"

"Yes. Josephine, if the sweets weren't indication enough, let this show you that I have feelings for you."

Josephine leaned forward then, kissing Ellana deeply, the elf's body going tense until she relaxed into the kiss and wrapped her arms around Josephine's body, the softness found there very compelling.
