1331222.content:
Two weeks passed, and as Josephine and Ellana spent more time together, the Elf became increasingly more capable of expressing her affections for her sweet dark skinned beauty without needing to use gifts. However, that didn’t stop a plate of cookies, a basket of fresh fruits, or other such treats and goodies from being left by Ellana for Josephine to find. It Antivan ambassador’s heart swell to know that her beloved thought of her so often, but she felt more than a little apprehensive when eating them, knowing that they would further bloat her already expanded figure. That was not enough to stop her from eating them, though, and it wasn’t just her appetite compelling her to eat anymore. She once tried to turn down Ellana’s offer, but the utter look of rejection on her adorable face made Josephine’s fat clogged heart break so she ate it anyway.

Leliana could be very over protective of Josephine, and had threatened the Inquisitor with some very unpleasant things should she careless with Josephine’s heart, though Josephine felt that it was her who needed to be careful. Josephine knew that Ellana had nothing but pure love for her, but between Ellana’s trouble expressing it, and her ineptitude in fields such as kissing, and other… activities, it was very clear that the noble was Ellana’s first love. While Josephine may not have had much experience in maters of the heart, the Dalish Elf had none whatsoever. If anyone’s feelings needed to be protected, it was Ellana’s.

So, Josephine kept eating whatever Ellana would leave for her, no mater the effects they would have on her figure, to spare the Inquisitor’s feelings. Her curves filled out even further, getting to the point that her corsets could hardly contain them, a second chin of soft fat began to form under her first, and even her arms were getting softer. Thankfully, Ellana hadn’t seemed to notice yet. She hadn’t brought up her weight once, and only ever had nice things to say about her. The most repeated was how much she adored Josephine’s skin. Just the thought of how the Elf would move her dainty finger gently across any patch of exposed skin while they cuddled by the fire sent a chill down her spine…

Shaking her head, Josephine returned her attention back to the papers on her desk, and absentmindedly started eating from a box of assorted chocolates. On top of everything that the Inquisitor left for her, her normal meals, and her snacking, Josephine had now taken to stress eating to help cope with all her work, especially since her parents had informed her about her engagement to Lord Otranto. Something she had intentionally neglected to tell Ellana about, which only added more stress.

A few hours later, the nagging sense of guilt from keeping her lover in the dark about the engagement became too much for Josephine, and she began to search Skyhold for Ellana. However, due to her being so out of shape, she didn’t get far. By the time she had searched the first floor of the keep, she was red in the face completely out of breath. Thankfully, Ellana found her before she fainted from exhaustion.

“There you are! I—” Josephine had to stop to take a few deed breaths before she could continue after she quickly trotted over to her beloved. “Excuse me—I’ve been looking everywhere for you! I’ve just received the most terrible news!” If she told Ellana that she had been sitting on this information for a while she feared it would only make it worse.

“What is it?!” Ellana asked with a tone of both worry and urgency.

Josephine hesitated before finally saying, “I’m engaged.”

“To… me?” It was very obvious that Ellana was very confused.

Josephine sighed in frustration, and began to explain the events that had led to Josephine being married to the Antivan Lord. “I must deal with this,” Josephine said when she had finished her explanation. “but until then, we cannot be seen in a compromising situation. I’m so sorry.”

Ellana was completely stunned. She had no idea what to do or say. After a long moment of silence, Ellana…

"Ellana, please, for the last time I can handle this," Josephine replied, gently taking her lover's hands in her own. Ellana hugged Josephine tighter then and allowed her dainty hand to sink fully into one of Josephine's fat sides. "Josephine, what if I told you that, once we're done with fighting off Corphyeus, that I wanted to...well...get larger, what would you think of that?"

Josephine looked into her eyes then, face flushing for an entirely different reason than exhaustion, and answered her.

1331222111.content:
--The Montilyet Estate--
-Josephine & Ellana's Room-
-Sunrise, 8:42 am-

Antiva City. Known commonly throughout Thedas as the capital city of Antiva, Antiva City was also one of the nation's largest port cities, perfect for trading both common and rare goods from the Rialto Bay, across the ocean and back. But to the local Antivans who are proud to call the coastal city their home, Antiva City was also budding and teeming with culture and entertainment. However, to the Elf woman, Ellana Lavellan... She became quite fond of the city that her beloved Josephine Montilyet calls home.

But as the sun's rays glimmered through the open balcony doors leading into their private chambers of the Montilyet Villa, Ellana slowly but surely stirred from her peaceful slumber, sluggishly sitting up on the lavish bed, groggily rubbing the sand from her eyes.

However, once she finally cleared her vision, Ellana was greeted by a sight that she was now all-too-familiar with at this point: A billowing blubbery paunch of a belly, which was mildly hidden underneath a plupm pair of cleavage.

Ever since she and the other members of the Inquisition finally defeated Corypheus once and for all, Ellana fulfilled her promise to Josephine about fattening herself up for the Antivan woman, along with taking an extended vacation with Josephine by spending time with her in her home country. And boy, did the female Elf Inquisitor pack on the pounds! At first, the two lovers initially encountered some difficulty involving an Elf voluntarily gaining weight due to their accelerated metabolism. Fortunately, Josephine was able to help her Elven lover in finding a solution to such a conundrum, which came in the form of special herbs that slowed down one's metabolic rate.

And over the course of nearly an entire year, Ellana's lithe and agile Elven physique was coated all over in thick ample layers of adipose and cellulite. Her once flat stomach now bulged and billowed outward with a hefty paunch of a belly and a scrumptious muffin top. Her waist and hips blimped outwards to accommodate for Ellana's blubbery behind, with each buttcheek now equally the size of ample watermelons, all whilst such girth was supported by a thick pair of bulbous thunder thighs. Meanwhile, her upper body prospered as well, now sporting a pair of hefty perky breasts, which were now freely displayed with no hinderance whatsoever. choices: She writes a song about a woman getting fatter and liking it to intrigue Sera.
Maryden thinks Sera wants to get fat, and she wants to help.
Maryden starts packing on the pounds thinking It would make Sera like her.
1451.content:
Krem was a beautiful man. That boy she sometimes (maybe?) saw was pretty cute. Neither of them, however, were so attractive that Maryden felt compelled write a song about them. Sera was. The Elven archer had only been at Haven at short while before she captured the minstrel’s heart, and on a whim Maryden wrote the song and began to preform it. Sure, she knew some might think it was a little creepy, after all they were acquaintances at best, but Maryden knew that music was the only medium through which true emotion could manifest. A song could be complex, dark, and serious, or simple, pure, and fun. Like Sera, and she felt Sera Was Never perfectly captured that. Plus, she was shit at flirting.

She was far a bumbling fool, but all her pickup lines either fell flat or completely went over people’s heads. They were closer to bad jokes than what anyone would consider a pickup line. Still, Maryden felt she should have stuck to flirting than writing the song, since it only seemed to make Sera feel uncomfortable; she would stop playing it if she didn’t get a sovereign from patrons requesting her to play it.

There was only one hope for Maryden if she wanted to win Sera over. At the end of every day she would sit down and write in her journal, and leave it on a barrel outside her room when she was done. Maryden didn’t want to read it. She knew it was wrong to invade something so private for personal gain. But she was going to do it anyway.

One day while Sera was out in the field with the Inquisitor, she snatched the book and started to look through it for anything that would help her woo Sera. It was mostly filled with short sentences; thoughts written down the second they entered Sera’s head. It was also filled with cute little doodles along with impressive sketches. -I think that minstrel Maryden is chatting me up. The song is creepy. That wasn’t a good sign. It was the only place she was mentioned and it was in a negative light. Then she started to notice a pattern.

-Baldy says Dalish don’t get fat. Didn’t think I could hate them more.
-Selling and buying people so you can get fatter? Instant bitch. Nice arse though. Won’t save her.
-Kerm should get fat. Don’t need to bind if they’re moobs.
-Met a lady Qunari. Tall. Fat. Woof.

As she read it became very clear that Sera had fat on the brain fairly often. One might even think she admired it. An idea then popped into Maryden’s head, and she put the book back in it’s place and sprinted to go carry it out.
1451.title: Sera Was Never (into Skinnier Girls)
